title: Docker Fundamentals
headline: Learn to use Docker to create environments for developing and running applications in this free online course.
description: Docker is a handy Linux-based service that provides lightweight environments for developing and running applications. Despite its usefulness, however, using Docker could confuse beginner programmers or those without experience using Linux. In this short course, we will get you up to speed on using the Docker platform. You will learn how Docker works, its installation process and how to create websites using its images and containers.
courseDescription:
While developing and testing applications, you could spend significant time ensuring an app works the same way on different machines. Docker addresses this by providing shareable, lightweight, container-based environments for developing and running applications. However, being a Linux-based platform, using Docker might come with a steep learning curve for beginners or programmers unfamiliar with terminal-centred platforms like Linux. Therefore, this course intends to provide you with a deep understanding of Docker and its use in creating environments.

We will begin by explaining how Docker technology works on the inside. Here, you will learn about the Docker Toolbox and the process for setting up and using Docker on various platforms. Next, we will introduce you to images and containers, the bread and butter of the Docker service. Investigate how to create images and web servers and master some helpful Docker commands. We explore a detailed exposition of the Docker Hub, followed by a thorough demonstration of how to run and customise containers.

Finally, you will learn to use your knowledge from the course to create a WordPress website in a Docker environment. Here you will be exposed to retrieving and using environment IP addresses and container host networks and will learn how to link containers to run certain services. You will have gained an enviable understanding of Docker commands, containers, Hub, images, networks, environments and much more in three hours or less. Start today!
